page.title: 17Sunny Sunday at Rye Harbour.
page.content: A Sunday morning at Rye Harbour is a meeting place for scores of people, particularly those who are{boating {enthusiasts.}Warm sunshine is all the incentive the tourist needs to be drawn to the banks of the River Rother to watch the{sailing dinghies or wind {surfers}who collect to share their effortless skills with the onlooker. The pub forecourt is invariably packed and the conversation often has a maritime flavour to it.The{new {lifeboat house}is the latest manifestation of Rye Harbour's ongoing relationship with the sea. Visitors alternatively flock to the {Information Centre}in the car park or take the 3/4 mile stroll to the mouth of the River Rother.When evening comes the village resumes its quiet community life.
